comment: I had Hasan Palta for Calc. 1 and he was amazing. If you go to class, ask questions, do the homework, and really really pay attention to the study guides, then you will pass. If you want to succeed in Calc and actually learn then take Palta. He is extremely kind and he will always be happy to help you. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE TAKE HIM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
10/10 Calc teacher. Tests are based off of study guide. Easy grader. Really nice guy and teaches the material well. Wants his students to succeed in the class. Overall made Calc very very easy.

He is very responsive. As long as you're doing your best, he will support you where you fall short. He takes his time with each section and doesn't overwhelm you with too much information in one day. He also provides a reasonable amount of time to complete homework.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: AMAZING PROFESSOR. take him!!!! He is so caring and has great sense of humor :). Calc was so easy with him.

He is an interesting professor. Professor Palta was intimidating at first, however later down the line warmed up to the class. He offers bonus quizzes and some questions on tests. I will say that his lectures are WAY simpler than what is on the hw or study guides. His tests are similar to the study guides which is nice.

I learned more form YouTube than I did from this professor don't take his class he can't teach his PowerPoint slides are packed with information that he doesn't explain he just does 2 examples says do you understand than switches slides and when you do ask a question it feels as though your making a fool of yourself don't take his class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: If you want to pass calc 1 I would definitely recommend you take him. The tests were pretty similar to the study guide. If you know how to do the study guide pretty well then you will pass his tests. He is a fairly easy grader. Just try your best and he will give you at least some credit on the problem. Overall great professor!

Great lecturer and a caring professor. Made calc I a very manageable course. If you attend his lectures and do the homework, you're going to pass and you'll probably really enjoy having him as your professor.

Can seem intimidating at first but is actually a very nice guy who wants all of his students to pass. His tests are made up of the easiest questions from the study guide, and will give you points even if you got a problem wrong. I do wish he put more grades into d2l, as I had no idea whether I was passing the class the entire semester.

Took calc a few times before him. If you want to pass take his class. He is super kind and understanding. So long as you show up to class for the pop quizzes and do his study guides you will pass! He will go the extra mile to make sure you succeed. Tests are 5 questions long but he isn't a hard grader, so long as you attempt problems you get points
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He makes Calc 1 as easy as possible and really wants you to pass. Also one of the nicest professors I have had.

Palta is a great person if you get to know him, but his class can be interesting. He reads off of PowerPoints and doesn't really do any of his own examples in class which didn't really match my learning style. But, his study guides for exams were extremely similar to the actual exam. You do have to teach yourself some stuff though due to his style.

Professor basically gives layout for exam with a study guide for each exam. Just complete the homework, make sure you know how to do every problem on the study guide and you'll be fine. He usually just picks problems from the study guide to put on the test.
Good teacher, learned a lot. He's very kind.
Take him if you want to pass Calculus. He is one of the best math professors. Study and do your homework and you will get the grade that you want.

I am not a calculus guy at all. This Teacher Makes sure that everyone does their best in every exam. He knows when students are struggling on one subject and helps them. Gives extra credit and he isn't a harsh grader.Calculus isn't easy and if it was, everyone could do it.

Dr. Palta is a great teacher and really wants to see his students succeed. I found his lectures to be easy to understand and he was open to questions. He explained things well, and if you pay attention to class/study guides, taking the tests will not be too hard.

Professor Palta was a very nice guy who wanted to see everyone succeed, however he was not the best teacher. He gives +5 points on top of your final grade if you attend all classes/complete the quizzes he passes out (which are purely graded on participation). He is not a tough grader, just be sure to show work and you'll recieve partial credit.

He is a very nice guy, but not a great teacher. I probably only passed thanks to the organic chemistry tutor on youtube. He is also a very strict grader, on the first test I got every problem right and still only got an 89 because he did not like the way I solved it. Some exams have extra credit problems though

I didn't chose Professor Palta when registering for classes, but I am glad I got him. Key to success in his class is Participation. Do the HW, Exam Reviews, and COME TO CLASS. 4 Tests 15% each, Final 20%, HW 20% and 5% extra credit for pop quizzes(for attendance, not based off of grade, all you need is to write you name). Work Hard, easy A.
